page.title: 08A FEN EDGE FARM
page.content: Chalk Farm covers an area of 480 acres and was established on former common fields and old heath as a result of parliamentary Enclosure. The area is predominantly chalk and the top-soil produces a medium loam. The farm consists of only four large fields. Each is between 96 and 126 acres in size. The fields have always been this size and have not recently been made larger to cope with modern machinery. The fields are bounded by hedges which contain some trees. There were many elm trees, but they were killed by Dutch Elm disease. New trees such as American Oaks are being planted to replace them; there are also many beech trees. This has always been an open area, without much woodland.
